title: Given rxns with dH values identify strongest bond

content.prompt:
CH4(g) + Cl(g) → CH3(g) + HCl(g) ΔH° = -14 kJ/molrxn

NH3(g) + Cl(g) → NH2(g) + HCl(g) ΔH° = -36 kJ/molrxn

H2O(g) + Cl(g) → OH(g) + HCl(g) ΔH° = + 40 kJ/molrxn

Based on the data above, what can be concluded regarding the strength of the C-H, N-H, and O-H bonds in the molecules shown?

choices.label: Nothing can be concluded without knowing the strength of the H- Cl bond.

skill.text: 6.D: Provide reasoning to justify a claim using chemical principles or laws, or using mathematical justification.
